How did you get 3.0.1, did you download the zip from the web or did you use the
update technology?

This was a new first time install from the zip file to an 'eclipse' directory 
off the 'C' drive.

Notice that the xerces plug-in appears as one of the unresolved plug-ins. Xerces
is not part of Eclipse 3.0.*. Have you extracted the 3.0.1 build on top of an
existing 2.1.* install? That is not supported. You have to extract the contents
of the zip file into an empty directory.

I only have one copy of eciplse, a 3.0.1 zip file, downloaded last week. It 
was extracted into a new eclipse directory. All of the files in the zip are 
dated 9/16/2004 between 11:58am and 12:02pm.

Could the downloaded zip be defective? Which configuration file would have 
provided that information?

Thanks,

David

Based on the last comment, I downloaded 3.0 and installed in a new directory 
(c:\tools\eclipse).

This version came up with no command line parameters added.

My guess is the 3.0.1 zip has an error.

I don't believe an invalid 3.0.1 zip would cause org.apache.xerces to appear in
your plugins directory (unless it was not provide by Eclipse.org).

Closing.
But it was provided from you downloads...

Installing the 3.0.1 build in another directory also works. So there must be 
some litter somewhere.

I got this exact same error today with eclispse 3.0.1. I installed a fresh 
install to c:\dev\tools. This is the first time I have installed exclipse on 
this machine.
